refnamediv.refpurpose: Returns the translation table used by htmlspecialchars and htmlentities

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: get_html_translation_table will return the translation table that is used internally for htmlspecialchars and htmlentities.

There are two new constants (HTML_ENTITIES, HTML_SPECIALCHARS) that allow you to specify the table you want. Default value for table is HTML_SPECIALCHARS. And as in the htmlspecialchars and htmlentities functions you can optionally specify the quote_style you are working with. The default is ENT_COMPAT mode. See the description of these modes in htmlspecialchars.

note.para: Special characters can be encoded in several ways. E.g. " can be encoded as ", " or &#x22. get_html_translation_table returns only the most common form for them.

refsect1.para: See also htmlspecialchars, htmlentities, and html_entity_decode.
